p: In alloxan-induced diabetic Wistar rats, both aqueous and ethanolic leaf extracts of E. psoraleoides (at 200 and 400 mg/kg) significantly decreased fasting blood glucose levels from day 6 of a 7-days treatment ( Nduka et al., 2018; Nduka et al., 2019). Using the same model, Elechi et al. (2019) investigated the effects of n-hexane, n-hexane/dichloromethane (1:1 v/v), dichloromethane, and dichloromethane/methanol (19:1 v/v) fractions of the n-hexane leaf extract of E. psoraleoides on the fasting blood glucose levels. The n-hexane/dichloromethane and the dichloromethane fractions at the dose of 200 mg/kg produced a significant decrease in fasting blood glucose levels from day 2–7, the effects of the dichloromethane fraction being higher or very close to that of 4 mg/kg glibenclamide ( Elechi et al., 2019).
